item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 3, 2024 at 4:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Touchscreens are out, and tactile controls are back (51 points | 18 comments)

3. Unix core utilities implemented in Haskell (103 points | 27 comments)

6. Big Data for the Leviathan (11 points | 1 comment)
7. Get me out of data hell (481 points | 179 comments)
8. The motor turns too much (328 points | 152 comments)
9. Ractor – a Rust Actor Framework (102 points | 42 comments)
10. Eighty Years of the Finite Element Method (2022) (172 points | 86 comments)

12. If you need the money, don't take the job (175 points | 111 comments)

14. Next Generation Out of Band Garbage Collection (139 points | 70 comments)

22. Saving historic cruise ships (34 points | 43 comments)
23. Intel might be too big to fail (39 points | 69 comments)

26. Prisma Postgres – Runs on bare metal and unikernels (255 points | 121 comments)
27. Security flaws found in Nvidia GeForce GPUs (183 points | 122 comments)
28. Ask HN: What would you preserve if the internet were to go down tomorrow? (34 points | 43 comments)
29. Repeatability: As Difficult as it is Important (37 points | 8 comments)
30. Boston Dynamics robot Atlas goes hands on [video] (207 points | 180 comments)
